alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Dubuque (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 2:49PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Delaware and southwestern Dubuque Counties through 330 PM CDT... At 245 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms along a line extending from near Greeley to near Cascade. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Heavy rainfall may lead to ponding of water and minor flooding on roadways and in low lying locations. Locations impacted include... Dyersville, Cascade, Epworth, Farley, Edgewood, Earlville, New Vienna, Colesburg, Worthington, Greeley, Delaware, Bernard, Oneida, Fillmore, New Wine Park, Fillmore Recreation Area, Twin Bridges Park and Petersburg. Rainfall amounts of 1 to 2.5 inches have fallen and an additional 1 inch of rain is possibble. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Stay away from flooded areas. Report any flooding to local law enforecement.
